headline: A 'Magnificent' China reset reignites the tech trade
text: A US-China trade war thaw is heating up the Magnificent Seven.

headline: Mag 7 rally, airline & pharmaceutical stocks: Trending Tickers
text: The "Magnificent Seven," made up of Nvidia (NVDA), Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL), Tesla (TSLA), Microsoft (MSFT), Amazon (AMZN), Meta (META), and Apple (AAPL), are rallying after the US and China agreed to lower tariff rates for a 90-day period. Airline stocks, like American Airlines (AAL), Delta (DAL), and United Airlines (UAL), are also gaining on the trade deal. Pharmacy stocks, including Eli Lilly (LLY), Johnson & Johnson (JNJ), and Merck (MRK), are moving to the downside after US President Trump said he will cut drug prices by over 50%. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

headline: Microsoft facing multibillion-pound legal claim over software licence pricing
text: The class action claim accuses the tech giant of overcharging for licences for Microsoft software products.

headline: Advanced Micro Devices Stock (AMD) Stuck in Neutral as AI Boom Accelerates
text: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) has been a disappointing stock over the past year, with declines accelerating in the last five months. Since May 2024, AMD has been down almost 32%. Amid growing concerns about demand for AI infrastructure chips, AMD has also struggled with a lack of competitiveness in absorbing that demand. headline: Popular YouTuber Coffeezilla Is Puzzled By Bill Gates' Philanthropy Plans—'I've Been Hearing This For 15 Years And Every Year Bill Has More'
text: Bill Gates, the co-founder of Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) and a tech industry titan, recently announced plans to give away 99% of his wealth by 2045, but not everyone is convinced. The billionaire, who became the world's youngest self-made billionaire at age 31 in 1987 and the first centibillionaire in 1999, currently holds a net worth of $113 billion, making him the 13th-richest person in the world, according to Forbes. Don't Miss: ‘Scrolling To UBI' — Deloitte's #1 fastest-growing software company

headline: Microsoft Is Renegotiating OpenAI Partnership for Future IPO. What It Means for the Stock.
text: Microsoft stock rose on Monday after a report that the company was revising the terms of its partnership with OpenAI to allow the ChatGPT maker to launch an initial public offering. The companies also are rewriting the terms of a wider contract that was drafted when Microsoft and OpenAI first unveiled an exclusive partnership in 2019, the Financial Times reported, citing people familiar with the matter. OpenAI didn’t immediately respond to a request for comment from Barron’s; Microsoft, through a spokesperson, declined to comment.

headline: Bill Gates says businesses need to understand the politics for the next 20 years, not just the next two days
text: Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates said AI is already reshaping the job sector and Trump's tariff uncertainty is adding further fuel to the fire.

headline: Microsoft, EFM ink forestry-based carbon removal deal
text: The carbon offtake deal with the forest investment and management firm will provide the tech giant 700,000 nature-based credits through 2035.

headline: Israeli quantum computing firm Classiq raises $110 million in private funding
text: JERUSALEM (Reuters) -Israeli quantum computing startup Classiq has raised $110 million in a mid-stage private funding round, it said on Monday, bringing its total fundraising to $173 million. Quantum computing holds the promise of carrying out calculations that would take today’s systems millions of years, and could unlock discoveries in medicine, chemistry and many other fields. Classiq's latest funding round was led by Entree Capital, with participation from Norwest, NightDragon, Hamilton Lane, Clal, Neva SGR, Phoenix, Team8, IN Venture, Wing, HSBC, Samsung Next and QBeat, as well as other new and existing investors, it said.

headline: How 'negative' sentiment is driving defensive tech bets
text: Tech stocks have clawed back some recent losses, but uncertainty around tariffs is keeping investors cautious. Baird Tech Strategist Ted Mortonson joins Market Domination to break down the shift in sentiment, highlighting why some still see big names like Microsoft (MSFT) and Amazon (AMZN) as relatively safe bets. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

headline: 3 Things Alphabet's Management Just Said That Should Make Tesla and Nvidia Investors Happy

headline: OpenAI and Microsoft renegotiate multibillion-dollar partnership terms - report
text: Investing.com -- OpenAI and Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ:MSFT) are currently in discussions to revise the terms of their multibillion-dollar partnership, according to a Financial Times report on Sunday.
